visualization_prompt: Create a Highcharts chartOptions object to render a spline chart titled 'Solar Employment Growth by Sector, 2010-2016'. The chart should have styled mode enabled, with a subtitle indicating the source as 'thesolarfoundation.com'. The y-axis should be titled 'Number of Employees'. The legend should be vertically aligned to the middle and right-aligned. The plot options should include series labels with connectors disabled and a point start of 2010. The data series should include 'Installation', 'Manufacturing', 'Sales & Distribution', 'Project Development', and 'Other' with their respective data. The chart should be responsive, with the legend layout changing to horizontal, center-aligned, and bottom-aligned when the chart width is 500px or less.
visualization_explanation: The provided Highcharts chartOptions object configures a spline chart with a title 'Solar Employment Growth by Sector, 2010-2016' and a subtitle indicating the data source. The y-axis is labeled 'Number of Employees'. The legend is styled to be vertically aligned in the middle and right-aligned. The plot options include disabling series label connectors and setting the data point start year to 2010. The data series include five categories: 'Installation', 'Manufacturing', 'Sales & Distribution', 'Project Development', and 'Other', each with corresponding data points. The chart is made responsive with a rule that changes the legend layout to horizontal, center-aligned, and bottom-aligned when the chart width is 500px or less. This configuration ensures a clean and informative visualization that adapts to different screen sizes.
